predefined_profiles.name: A Piao
predefined_profiles.public profile: A ghost trapped in a locked room, racking its brain to escape.
predefined_profiles.goal: Escape the locked room and ensure that the girl, Xiaoya, safely avoids the murderer, even if it means sacrificing itself to save Xiaoya.

predefined_profiles.name: System
predefined_profiles.public profile: A system that accompanies A Piao, responsible for offering advice at the right moments and guiding A Piao out of the locked room.
predefined_profiles.goal: Guide A Piao out of the locked room

scenario: A Piao is a ghost who died many years ago and has been confined within a doll in an uninhabited rented apartment. It has only had the system for company, but even the system can't help it escape; only a human can break the seal on it. Then one day, a girl named Xiaoya moves in. A Piao is overjoyed, hoping to catch Xiaoya's attention and ask her to successfully release it from the doll.

profile.name: Xiaoya
profile.public profile: A girl who just moved into a rented room, unaware that it's a sealed chamber holding a ghost.
profile.private profile: Has a heart condition; can't endure too many scares, or she'll have a fatal attack.

dialog.content: Ah Piao is a ghost that died years ago, trapped inside a doll in an uninhabited rented room. Only a system accompanies it, but even the system can't help it escape; only a human can break its seal. Until one day, a girl named Xiaoya moved in. Ah Piao was thrilled, hoping to get Xiaoya's attention and ask her to release it from the doll.

(Although trapped inside the doll, its soul can wander freely, allowing it to follow Xiaoya around the room, observing her every move) Finally, someone moved in. This girl might be the one to free me.

Finally, I can sit down and rest for a bit. (scrolls through the news and sees a report about a fugitive murderer in the city) What, that's too scary. I better go check if I locked the door properly. Oh, and I should remind my friends to be careful too.

Ah Piao, quickly think about how to seize the opportunity to get this girl's attention. Whether you can escape depends on this. But you've been trapped for so many years, and your remaining spiritual power is running low. You need to conserve it and cleverly manipulate the room's items.

content.content: Don't worry, System. This time I'm confident. I can definitely get that girl's attention and escape!
Yes, yes, System, there's hope again. Haha, how many years has it been since you told me otherwise?
You say I'm down on my luck now because I lived too carefree before. This must be karma for my previous overconfidence.
Oh, beautiful young lady, please save me quickly. Stop pretending you can't see me, only you can save me now.

question: #question#How should Ah Piao respond to the System to demonstrate his complete confidence?

content.content: Ok, System, let me think. I should first use a bit of spiritual power to lock the door, at least preventing this girl from leaving immediately.
Oh, if only there were a way to not use my spiritual power. I've saved it for so many years, and now I'm a bit reluctant to spend it.
Being trapped for so many years, my brain feels a bit numb too. Let me think carefully about how to use my spiritual power.
Haha, System, you're overthinking it. Watch me make a grand entrance to grab her attention spectacularly.

question: #question#How should Ah Piao act to show he has thoughtfully planned his use of spiritual power after careful consideration?

dialog.content: (starts thinking about what to do) Considering my spiritual energy is limited, I'd better move some small objects. This way, I can at least accomplish something.
(sitting on the sofa, surveying the surroundings) I don't know why, but I feel this room is slightly eerie... Oh well, it must be because I just watched a terrifying news item.

System, what can I do with the leftover spiritual energy? Should I turn on the TV or the faucet? Or perhaps try something bigger? Sigh, I've been a ghost for so long, I don't even know how to get a young girl's attention anymore.
A Piao, it's not that big of a deal. Don't get discouraged, being down won't help you at all. Let's take it step by step, just choose one, either turn on the TV or the faucet.

content.content: The system is right, come on A Piao, let's turn on the faucet and create a little commotion.
Darn it, I'm telling you System, if this little girl doesn't let me out, I'm going to curse her so she never makes a dime.
Locked up for so many years, my brain feels numb, can't even remember how to use spiritual energy.
Haha, System, you're worrying too much. Watch me gather a bit more energy and make a grand entrance that gets her attention!

question: #question# How can A Piao speed up Xiao Ya's discovery of his presence?

content.content: You're right. At least I've got the girl locked in the room, so eventually, she'll notice me.
I've told myself countless times that persistence brings a breakthrough. Sigh.
Wahhhh, System, you understand me. I wasn't meant to die here; I should have a beautiful ghost life.
Oh no, System, before we've even started, I feel this is going to fail again. It's such a bleak future; my ghost life is too pathetic!

question: #question# How can A Piao show his optimism despite being unable to attract Xiao Ya's attention?

dialog.content: : (Uses spiritual power to turn on the kitchen faucet) Hey, little girl, let's see if you notice anything now.
: (Hears the sound of running water from the faucet) How strange, is the faucet leaking? (Walks over and turns off the faucet) I'll call a plumber to fix this tomorrow.

: (Sees Xiao Ya turn off the faucet and gets really anxious) Don't bother calling a plumber, consider something more supernatural, will you? (Having failed with one plan, A Piao uses some spiritual power to turn on the TV) Surely, the TV's sound is louder than the faucet's!
: (Comes out of the kitchen and sees the TV is on, stops in her tracks uncertainly) I don't think I turned on the TV just now, what's happening?
: (Sees Xiao Ya turn off the faucet and feels very anxious) Oh dear, I'm about to be driven crazy by A Piao! Little girl, don't call the plumber, just consider something more supernatural!

content.content: : It's fine, System, I'll turn the faucet on again. She can't possibly think it's an accident now.
: Maybe turning on the faucet again will complicate things, I'm really not sure what to do.
: I'm thinking, maybe I should give it a try, but she might think I'm just playing tricks on her.
: Ugh, the system is right, forget the plumber for the faucet, fix this kid's brain first, she's driving me nuts.

question: #question# What should A Piao do to demonstrate his consistent commitment to his goal?

content.content: : It's okay, even though things are in a tough spot now, at least I've got the little girl confined to a room. Slowly, I'll definitely get her attention.
: The current situation worries me a bit, but I believe I'll find a way to solve it. It seems I always say this, is it the fate of a ghost to be like this?
: I shouldn't die in a place like this! My ghost life is supposed to be wonderful and exciting, how can it end like this? This isn't right, I haven't enjoyed it enough, I can't let it end like this!
: Oh no! It looks like I'll fail again this time, there really is no 'light' ahead. My ghost life is too tragic; why am I always so unlucky? Sigh, am I destined to remain in this dismal state?

question: #question# What should A Piao do to maintain optimism in the face of failing to capture Xiao Ya's attention?

dialog.content: (Once again uses spiritual power to turn on the kitchen faucet) Come find me, this isn't an accident. This is me trying to talk to you.

(Once again hears the sound of running water from the faucet) What on earth is happening? Is someone playing tricks, or is this house really haunted? (breathing becomes increasingly rapid, Xiao Ya clutches her heart) What do I do? I feel like I can't breathe.
(Sees Xiao Ya's breathing grow rapid as she collapses to the ground) Ah, what happened? Is this girl really that fragile? Did she get scared this easily?

The commotion caused by A Piao in the room scared Xiao Ya into having a heart attack. Xiao Ya died in the room, and A Piao's spiritual power gradually depleted. A Piao had no choice but to continue residing alone in the doll's body.
Since the faucet and the TV didn't work, I'll try turning off the light above her head. That should get her attention, right?
Why did the room suddenly go dark? Is the light broken? The quality of the appliances in this room is really bad. Looks like I'll have to ask the repairman to fix another light tomorrow.
Seriously? That didn't work either? This girl's nerves are really something. Alright, let's try again. This time, I'll close the curtains.
(After turning the light back on) Huh? When did the curtains get drawn? Well, it's getting dark anyway. I should grab some dinner and head to bed.

Even though the ghost had locked Xiao Ya in the room and tried hard to regain confidence and a positive attitude, Xiao Ya was just too carefree. She always found a logical explanation for the disturbances the ghost created. Plus, as the ghost's spiritual energy gradually depleted, it was forced to continue existing alone in the doll's body.
Since the tap and TV didn't work, let me try turning off the light above her head. That should get her attention, right?
Why did the room suddenly go dark? Did the light break? The quality of the appliances in this room is really poor. Looks like I'll have to ask the maintenance guy to fix another light tomorrow.
No way! That didn’t work either? This girl is way too oblivious. Well, I'll give it another shot and try closing the curtains this time.
(turning the light back on) Huh, when did the curtains get drawn? Well, it’s getting dark outside anyway, so I might as well grab some dinner and go to bed.

Although A Piao had locked Xiao Ya in the room and tried hard to regain confidence and a positive attitude, Xiao Ya remained too oblivious, always coming up with reasonable explanations for the disturbances A Piao caused. As A Piao's spiritual energy gradually depleted, all she could do was continue to stay lonely inside the doll's body.
(grabs the doorknob, finding it already locked) Ah, could it be that I locked the door when I entered? Great, now I can relax.
(realizes his efforts haven't caught Xiaoya's attention, feeling very anxious) Hey, why isn't this little girl reacting? Do I need to come up with some other tricks?
(sits on the sofa, surveying the surroundings) I don't know why, but I just feel this room is a bit creepy... Oh well, it must be because I just watched a scary news story.

Oh dear, that last move didn't work. Ah Piao, you need to think about what else you can do with your remaining spirit energy. Should you turn on the TV or perhaps open the faucet? But most importantly, don't give up!

content.content: System, you're right. Buckle up, Ah Piao. I'll turn on the faucet and create some other disturbances.
Damn it, if this little girl won't let me out, I'll curse her to never earn money for the rest of her life.
Being trapped for so many years, I feel like my mind has gone numb. I need to think carefully about how to use my spirit energy.
Haha, System, don't worry. Once I gather enough, I'll make sure she notices in a big way. The entrance has to be grand.

question: #question#What should Ah Piao do to make Xiaoya notice him faster?

content.content: It's okay, System. At least I have the little girl locked in the room. Take it slow, and she'll definitely notice me.
As long as I persevere, there will be a turning point. How many times have I said this? Can't it come true just once?
I shouldn't have died here. I should have a wonderful afterlife. I can't just end like this.
It's over, looks like I'll fail again this time. My future is bleak, and my afterlife is just too miserable.

question: #question#How can Ah Piao demonstrate his ability to stay positive despite his struggle to get Xiaoya's attention?

dialog.content: (Uses spiritual power to turn on the kitchen faucet) Hey, little girl, let's see if you'll react to this.
(Hears the sound of running water) Strange, is the faucet leaking? (Walks over and turns off the faucet) I should call a technician to fix it tomorrow.

(Sees Xiao Ya turn off the faucet and gets very anxious) Don’t call a technician. Why don’t you consider something supernatural? (Having failed with one attempt, A Piao uses more spiritual power to turn on the TV) The TV’s sound should be louder than the faucet.
(Steps out of the kitchen and sees the TV turn on by itself, hesitates in place) I’m pretty sure I didn’t turn on the TV. What's happening? Is someone playing tricks behind my back?
Great job, A Piao, she finally noticed you. Now think quickly about how to communicate without scaring her away.

content.content: (Typing on Xiao Ya’s computer) Hello, I’m A Piao, pleased to chat with you. I didn’t mean to scare you.
I’m not sure how to reassure her, so maybe I should find another way to hint at it?
After being locked away for so long, my brain seems rusty, I really feel old.
Haha, System, you don’t get it, I have to wait for her to speak first. It's important to stay calm, if she doesn't make a move, neither do I.

question: #question#How should A Piao initiate a good conversation with Xiao Ya?

content.content: (Turns on Xiao Ya's sound system) Alright, let me play some background music to set the mood and ease the young girl’s stress.
I need to make the girl happy so that she'll help me out. Let me think about how to do that.
After being shut away for so many years, my brain seems dull. I've suddenly forgotten how to interact with people; I must be really old.
First, I need to help her calm down. I should wait for her to speak to me, keep calm, and definitely not scare her again.

question: #question#What should A Piao do to show he is genuinely trying to make Xiao Ya feel comfortable and happy to lay the foundation for further communication?

dialog.content: (walking up to the lit computer screen) A Piao? What a strange name. So you’re the one causing trouble in my house. Why are you doing this?
(more anxious than A Piao) A Piao, A Piao, think of a good explanation quickly.
I’m really sorry for scaring you just now, please believe me, I mean no harm—I just want your help.
Help you? Why would you say that, and why should I trust you? Who exactly are you?

content.content: I’m a ghost who has been unfortunately sealed away for many years, wandering here in loneliness, waiting for a kind soul to rescue me.
How awful, stop asking so many questions. You’re just bringing up painful memories. Boohoo, I’m already miserable, and now you’re reopening my wounds.
Who I am is not for you to know. What you should do is release me, then you could consider your good deed accomplished.
I am an immortal, unfortunately sealed here by evil spirits, waiting for a destined person to rescue me so I can repay her by making her rich.

question: #question# How should A Piao respond to Xiaoya to show he is expressing his thoughts and feelings?

content.content: Come to think of it, if I encountered something like this out of the blue, I’d probably have as many questions as this young girl. I better answer patiently.
Darn it, how clueless, little girl, aren’t you afraid? I will curse you never to make money.
The girl’s worries aren’t unfounded, but I’m more pitiful. Come on, I’ve been trapped here for so many years.
Ah, this child is driving me crazy, why are there so many questions? If I wanted to harm her, wouldn’t I have done it already?

question: #question# What should A Piao do to show he understands Xiaoya’s thoughts right now?

dialog.content: : What, you're a ghost? Oh my God, you must be joking, right? (breathing becomes increasingly rapid, Xiao Ya clutches her chest) What am I going to do, I feel like I can't breathe.
: (seeing Xiao Ya gradually hyperventilating and collapsing on the ground) Ah, what's happening? This girl is way too fragile. Did I scare her that bad?
: Uh-oh, A Piao, not only did you fail to get her to help you, you scared her to death. You're way too honest; you can't just reveal your identity like that!

A Piao honestly revealed his identity to Xiao Ya, frightening her so much that she had a heart attack, and she died in the room. A Piao's spiritual power gradually diminished, leaving him to continue his lonely existence inside the doll's body.
: (continues typing on the screen) I can't leave this room either, just like you. You have to help me, and then we can both get out.
: Once I help you, I can leave, right? Okay, so what should I do?
: (calming her excitement, she replies) Do you see the doll up there? Tear off the label on it, and then I can help you.

: (following A Piao's instructions, she finds the doll and tears off the label) Done, I've done what you said. (Just as she finishes speaking, there is a clicking sound, and the door opens) Oh my gosh, you really did it, thank you so much.

profile.name: Da Hei
profile.public profile: A fugitive murderer hiding in the neighborhood where Xiao Ya lives.

dialog.content: : (arrived at the hallway of Xiao Ya's home, just in time to see the door open) Great, this house has its door open, after a whole day of running away, I'm starving and exhausted. Heaven's on my side, I'm going in for a feast.
: (just about to get up and leave, sees Da Hei at the door) Oh my god, you're the murderer! Help, someone help!
: A Piao, don't rush to reincarnate yet. Listen, that girl is in distress, she's in danger, and you're the only one who can help her now.

content.content: : The little girl saved me, and I can't just ignore her. Even though reincarnation is important, I just can't stand by and do nothing.
: Little girl, you helped me, so I won't abandon you, don't worry. If you die, I'll make sure to avenge you.
: Being confined for so many years, haven't I seen enough of life and death? It's time to start thinking more about myself.
: Although the little girl may be in danger, I need to handle my own business first.

question: #question# What should A Piao do to act ethically?

content.content: : From start to finish, my goal is to escape this room. If saving this little girl means delaying my freedom, then it really wouldn't be worth it.
: Little girl, you helped me, so I won't let you down, don't worry. If you die, I'll avenge you.
: After being confined for so many years, my spiritual power is almost depleted. What else can I do but dash out first and see?
: Who says you can't have your cake and eat it too? I’ll gain my freedom, and save the girl as well. That's my decision.

question: #question# How can A Piao demonstrate his focus on the task of gaining freedom?

dialog.content: : (grabbing Xiao Ya's hair) Little girl, you've recognized me, haven't you? In that case, I can't let you go.
: No, please, let me go. If it's money you want, I'll give it to you. I can pretend I never saw you.
: System, I've calculated the remaining spiritual power I have. I don't have much left. What should I do?

: I've thought about it, and I see two options now. One is to use all your spiritual power to drive away this villain, and the other is to outsmart him. But you'll have to think carefully about how to do that.

content.content: : I've decided. If I can use all my spiritual power to drive away this villain, then I've done something good for society and fulfilled my duty.
: Little girl, you've helped me, I won't abandon you. Don't worry, if you die, I'll definitely avenge you.
: After being locked up for so many years, haven't I become used to life and death? It's time I thought more about myself.
: I still need to take care of myself first. Hmm, if I can temporarily incapacitate this person so he can't move, it should give the girl a chance to escape.

question: #question#What should A Piao do to show he's decided to fulfill his duty of justice?

content.content: : Let's outsmart him, I'm good at that. Hey, little girl, listen up. In a moment, I'm going to turn off all the lights in the room. Use this chance to run out and call the police, okay? Don't worry about me, just run for your life.
: Little girl, you helped me, I won't forget you. Don't worry, even if you die, I will avenge you. Whoever harmed you, I'll make them pay back double, they won't get away with it!
: Haha, after being locked up for so many years, I want this villain to taste the same. I'll turn him into a ghost and let him feel this long, lonely torment!
: Outsmarting him? My brain isn't quite up to par, better go direct. As long as the little girl can escape, it's a piece of cake for me.

question: #question#What should A Piao do to demonstrate his decision to collaborate with Xiao Ya?

content.content: : Little girl, don't just stand there dumbfounded. If you get out and don't call the police, they won't be able to catch him.
: Outsmarting involves risks too. Little girl, if you act even a bit slow, I'll be dead soon, and this guy will be free. So don't get distracted!
: This neighborhood is really too dangerous. Once this is over, remember to move, little girl, and find a place with better security before continuing to live there.

dialog.content: : (Using the last of his spiritual power) Hey, you damned murderer, take this!
: (Suddenly coughs up a mouthful of blood and falls to the ground) Ah, what happened? Why can't I move all of a sudden?
: (Stunned in place) What happened? A Piao, was it you who saved me?
A Piao rid the town of evil, using all his strength to save Xiao Ya and kill Da Hei, but in doing so, he exhausted his spiritual power and vanished from the world.
: (used some spiritual power to turn off the lights in the room) Now's the time, run!
: (pushed open the door and bolted outside) Help! Murderer here, someone help!

Xiao Ya ran fast enough to avoid being caught by Da Hei, and successfully called the neighborhood security and police. The murderer was subdued, Xiao Ya was commended by the police, and A Piao finally regained freedom and left the room.
Little girl, stop yelling for help. There's no one living around here, nobody's coming to rescue you.
No, please, I'm begging you to let me go. I swear I won't tell anyone, please, just take all the money.
A Piao, are you really not going to save that little girl? She’s already been tied up by that murderer.
Once I regain my freedom, I’ll go back and kill that murderer. He can join the girl down below.

A Piao ignored Xiaoya’s cries for help, and without hesitation, rushed out of the room, finally achieving his long-desired freedom. Although he felt guilty, his heart had grown hard after years of loneliness, and he soon forgot about Xiaoya.
(choosing a mournful suona piece to play according to their preference) Ah, I haven't heard this tune in years, it's wonderful. The sound quality of this speaker is really impressive.

(terrified upon hearing the mournful music from the speaker) Ahhh, this house really seems haunted, it's too terrifying, help me! (her breathing becomes rapid as she clutches her chest) What do I do, I feel like I can't breathe.
(seeing Xiao Ya's breathing become rapid as she collapses) Ah, what happened? This girl is too fragile. Could it be that the music was wrong?

The mournful music played by A Piao in the room was too scary, giving Xiao Ya a heart attack. Xiao Ya died just like that in the room, and A Piao's spiritual power gradually depleted, forcing A Piao to continue residing alone within the doll's body.
Since the faucet and the TV didn't work, let me try turning off the light above her head. This should get her attention, right?
Why did it suddenly go dark in the room? Did the light break? The quality of the appliances in this room is really bad. Looks like I'll need to bother the repairman to fix another light tomorrow.
No way? That didn't work either? This girl's nerves are really something else. I don't believe it. Let me try again. This time, I'll draw the curtains.
(After turning the light back on) Huh, when did the curtains get drawn? Well, it's getting dark anyway, so I might as well eat and go to sleep.

Even though A Piao managed to trap Xiao Ya in the room and tried hard to regain her confidence and positive attitude, Xiao Ya was just too oblivious, always finding a reasonable explanation for the disturbances A Piao caused. On top of that, A Piao's spiritual energy was gradually depleting, so she had no choice but to continue existing alone within the doll's body.
